newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish PM says can still halve jobless by 2000.
newsitem.headline: Swedish PM says can still halve jobless by 2000.

text.p: Swedish Prime Minister Goran Persson said on Tuesday that he was still confident his government could halve unemployment by the year 2000.
"Of course this can happen if you want it to and if you believe it is possible," Persson told a seminar of his ruling party, the Social Democrats.

Persson based his optimism on, among other things, the latest forecast from Sweden's Labour Board that, according to him, showed unemployment falling to six percent by 2000 with moderate growth and without new measures.
Swedish unemployment in February was 8.8 percent.
"Thereby the task is to reduce unemployment by a further 80,000 people over three years," he said.
